intro: Aglaia wallichii var. brachystachya, commonly known as the short-stalked aglaia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and related trees. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered yellowish-green flowers. Its fruits are woody capsules that contain several seeds. This variant is distinguished by its shorter floral stalks compared to the typical variety of Aglaia wallichii.
